com.pstmetro.dijkstra

Class DijkstraAlgorithm<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pstmetro.dijkstra.DijkstraAlgorithm<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - The type of the Node, in this case a DijkstraAlgorithm<MetroNode> would be created.

extends Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • DijkstraAlgorithm

        public DijkstraAlgorithm(DijkstraGraph<V> map,
                 V source)
        A Generic "Greedy" Path-finding algorithm.
        This algorithm is greedy in the sense that it makes a locally optimal choice at each step and does not take into account the global structure.
        The constructor instantiates the required maps and adds local pointers to the arrays of Connections and Nodes.
        Parameters:
        map - The DijkstraGraph used to acquire the array of nodes and array of connections
        source - The Initial node
        See Also:
        Run(), the start of the algorithm.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        private void run()
        The bulk of the algorithm. This code is run once, when this method terminates we can assume the Algorithm has finished.
        Note: Please view this in the HTML Javadoc as the Netbeans Autoformat tool doesn't manage this very well.

        The loop will continue while: 
         (uncheckedNodes.size() > 0)
        The list is not iterated upon, this ensures that we can add and remove from the list without throwing a ConcurrentModificationException

        1. The node with the quickest previously tested connection is returned via: getClosest(Set) 
         V node = getClosest(uncheckedNodes);
        2. This node is removed from the uncheckedNodes and added to the checkedNodes in order to prevent the algorithm from re-checking this node in the next step. 
         checkedNodes.add(node);
 uncheckedNodes.remove(node);
        3. The nodes neighbours that have not yet been checked are gathered via getUncheckedConnections(V)
        4. The neighbours are then checked against any previous assigned time/value from checking one of this nodes neighbours
        if this node is found to be faster than the previous assigned value: 
         getFastestPreviousTime(currentNode) > getFastestPreviousTime(node) + getCostOfConnection(node, currentNode)
        See: getFastestPreviousTime(V), getCostOfConnection(V,V)
        5. The previous times and nodes are replaced with the new values.
        6. Return to the loop until the uncheckedNodes Set is empty.

        When this method has completed, the user is able to any quickest journey pull from the getJourney(V) method

      • getClosest

        private V getClosest(Set<V> nodes)
        This method chooses the next node from the uncheckedNodes set.
        if the set contains no nodes that have been previously checked, the first iterated node will be chosen.
        Parameters:
        nodes - The set of nodes from which we will get the node with the shortest path.
        Returns:
        The node with the lowest previously checked connection time.

      • checkNode

        private void checkNode(V node)
        Loops through all the connections to the desired node, if the time to this node + all previous times from this node is lower than any previously saved value, the value and previousNode is replaced.
        Parameters:
        node -

      • getCostOfConnection

        protected int getCostOfConnection(V node,
                      V destination)
        Loops through all the connections, if the connection between the nodes is found, it is returned.
        Parameters:
        node - The source node.
        destination - the destination node.
        Returns:
        the cost of the connection
        Throws:
        RuntimeException, - if no connection is found connecting the 2 nodes.

      • getFastestPreviousTime

        protected int getFastestPreviousTime(V node)
        Checks for a previously saved time it would take to reach this node. if it is found, it is returned, else, Integer.MAX_VALUE is returned.
        Parameters:
        node -
        Returns:
        Either a previously saved value or Integer.MAX_VALUE

      • getUncheckedConnections

        protected List<V> getUncheckedConnections(V source)
        returns the unchecked connections where this node is the source.
        Parameters:
        source - The node that is the source of the connections.
        Returns:
        a List of nodes.

      • getJourney

        public NodeLinkedList<V> getJourney(V target)
        Returns the Journey from source to the target. This is achieved by creating a linked list that will serve as the order of the Path to take, we then add to this list by retrieving from the map of nodes and continue this process until the current step becomes null. The LinkedList is then reversed giving our path from start to finish.
        Parameters:
        target - the destination node.
        Returns:
        a List of the nodes required to traverse in order to arrive at the target node.

      • getSource

        public V getSource()
        Returns the source of this current algorithm.
        Returns:
        the source of this current algorithm.
